Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 104th overall pick, by Cleveland in 2015...
Injured on 7/6/2015 with a Tender Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 7/15/2016 with a Blister On Finger, out for 4 days...
Traded from Cleveland to Toronto on 7/23/2016 (Going to CLE: LF Yonder Alonso, 3B Harold Martinez. Going to TOR: P Florentino Maurice, CF Cole Gillespie, 3B John Rose)...
Earned first career win on 5/18/2017...
Had first career hit on 6/15/2017, off Keaton Hayenga (NYM)...
Was selected to the 2018 Allstar game...
Injured on 8/10/2018 with a Pulled Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Won World Series with Toronto in 2018...
Injured on 5/18/2019 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
1/31/2021: Gets a new one-year contract worth $550,000 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Toronto to Seattle on 5/11/2021 (Going to SEA: P Florentino Maurice. Going to TOR: 1B George Demarest, 2B Ralph Bannon, P Hoyt Perera)...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/3/2021, winning 2 games with a 0.56 ERA...
Injured on 7/15/2021 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 3-4 weeks...
Injured on 9/14/2021 with a Fractured Elbow, out for 7 weeks...
1/31/2022: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,628,571 through salary arbitration...
Won World Series with Seattle in 2022...
1/31/2023: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,628,571 through salary arbitration...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/6/2024 to a 4-year deal worth $10,000,000 per year...
Hit first career homerun on 6/17/2024, off Christopher Acosta (ARI)...
Was selected to the 2024 Allstar game...
